ygData.subject: gladiator refuses to run & other
ygData.msgSnippet: Ok, somehow, gladiator crashes when I start to run it.  I had a level 568 archmage.  Thankfully, I forgot to save the game when I ran over too much magic

From: "dph of rules " <dph_of_rules@...>

Ok, somehow, gladiator crashes when I start to run it.  I had a level 
568 archmage.  Thankfully, I forgot to save the game when I ran over 
too much magic power, and I brought the archmage back.  This time, I 
did not raise the intelligence any (I rounded up to the next 100) and 
I did not have an archmage with too much magic power.  All was going 
well because I could do any attack without running out of magic power 
(for some reason, the game waits a few seconds before letting you 
summon another image or fire elemental).  Is there any way of getting 
the game up running again without installing it into another folder?

The good news (if that could be considered good news) is that I found 
some limits and it will improbable (not impossible) to get a 
legitimate team up to that point.  However, I refuse to disclose the 
details of the scenarios that I used to bring my level 256 archmage to 
level 500+, except to say that a single character (other than 
archmage) can not handle those scenarios.

A while back, some was commenting that rocks thrown by elves are not 
very good.  Let me explain something that I learned.  Rocks thrown by 
level 3000+ elves have a tendacy to never go away.  When you consider 
the potency of those rocks, you realize that an army of summoned fire 
elementals does not have a snowball's chance in the rainforest against 
such opponents.

That said, I believe Tents are the most efficient way to raise an army 
of so called 'gods'.  Even if your summoned fire elementals do not 
have a prayer, all you need is the fire elemental to last long enough 
to take out a tent.
